attributes.action: Reverse the Mortgage Interest tax relief restriction on ‘individual’ landlords
attributes.background: Thousands of buy-to-let landlords will see their earnings hit after George Osborne cracked down on mortgage interest tax relief in his summer Budget.

attributes.action: Elmbridge Borough to become 33rd London borough following EU referendum
attributes.background: As London voted to remain in the EU, it is more evident than ever the similarities that the Borough of Elmbridge in North Surrey shares with neighbouring Greater London. As talks of further devolution of London develop, Elmbridge citizens must be protected.
attributes.additional_details:
In the EU referendum, 60% voted to remain with a turnout of 78%, similar to that of London.
Elmbridge has a vibrant economy with over 5000 firms situated in the borough.
Over 45% of Elmbridge's population are educated to degree level.
Unemployment peaked at 7% in 1993 but since then has been on the decline and reached a low of 0.9% in 2000.

attributes.action: Abolish chancel repair liability
attributes.background: Chancel repair liability is an outdated burden created when Henry VIII destroyed monasteries and gave away their land, rarely mentioned in  deeds to property, but by which some property owners have been asked to pay the cost of repairing the chancel of the church relevant to their property.
attributes.additional_details:
Claims for payment are usually based on old maps of former church property.  Church and diocese records which might relate to this matter are often incomplete or non-existent or have been destroyed because no one realised that they might have some significance.

Lord Avebury's Bill to abolish chancel repair liability in the House of Lords fell due to lack of time in the parliamentary session before the general election in 2015.  The property of many people is subject to chancel repair notices.

attributes.action: Make it offence to film members of the emergency service for negative propaganda
attributes.background: There has been a recent increase in the number of cases via media channels (Facebook, YouTube) by members of the public recording Emergency Services, NHS and HM forces personnel, whilst causing harassment to provoke a reaction so the footage can be uploaded and used a negative propaganda.
attributes.additional_details: Propaganda is defined by Nelson (1996) as "a systematic form of purposeful persuasion that attempts to influence the emotions, attitudes, opinions, and actions of specified target audiences for ideological, political or commercial purposes through the controlled transmission of one-sided messages (which may or may not be factual) via mass and direct media channels.

attributes.action: Implement RSPCA approved standards to all UK livestock farms
attributes.background: We must keep adhering to the 5 Freedoms. EU standards require animals to be inspected once a day, sow stalls are still used for the first 4 weeks of pregnancy, meat chickens have avg. 7cm of space (33kg per m² avg. weight 2.4kg), 550cm² for egg laying hens, calves are only put into groups at 8 weeks
attributes.additional_details:
RSPCA welfare standards should be implemented as the standard practice: http://science.rspca.org.uk/sciencegroup/farmanimals/standards
EU law: 
http://www.ciwf.org.uk/media/3818623/eu-law-on-the-welfare-of-farm-animals.pdf
https://www.gov.uk/guidance/animal-welfare#on-farm-animal-welfare

If we can't improve our standards to RSPCA level, it is paramount these animals do not have to endure any more suffering than they already do under EU law. Ideal: CCTV in livestock farms for RSPCA to access

attributes.action: Make government responses to petitions more productive.
attributes.background: The responses to petitions started online more often than not simply sustain that "the government is confident it has made the right decision." This is hugely counter-productive in easing the public's concerns over government actions.
attributes.additional_details:
Given that a petition gains the appropriate number of signatures to be responded to, it is clear that a large number of people disagree that the government has made the right decision, and reiterating this statement without any due consideration for why or where the concerns are coming from defeats the object of having this platform for petitions. 
Concerns must be understood and responded to with possible courses of action to improve the situation brought to attention by the petitions.

attributes.action: Stop forced adoption. It's destroying families, our children are not your profit
attributes.background: We need a full investigation on how SS work taking children from their mum when no acutal harm has come to their child, however they say that there 'could be potential harm'. It costs more to adopt out then to keep the baby with the mother, something needs to be done, our children are at risk.
attributes.additional_details: forced adoption happens in secret family courts, a council are given a target to meet on how many babies/children they need to adopt to get bonuses. John hemming, a known mp who knows all about this matter and sees the doings. Understandingly I know ss have the duty of care to a child I don't disputes that but ever since baby p (bless hes soul) mothers that wouldn't put their babies at harm are paying the price or living the consequences of how you had a bad up bringing

attributes.action: Replace 5p plastic bags for PAPER BAGS.
attributes.background:
We, students at the School of Social and Behavioural Sciences at Kingston University, would like to see the offer of plastic bags by supermarkets and shopping outlets replaced by PAPER bags instead.
Paper bags can be very sturdy and are eco-friendly. 
Please, join us in our campaign.
attributes.additional_details:
We are also having a competition of art work based on Paper Bags, which will be exhibited at Stanley Picker Gallery (London).
More details about will be available at our Twitter account: @PaperBagsKU

attributes.action: Allow current/new students to have free text books for university courses
attributes.background: It is only fair that current/new students get the fulfilment of their university course they pay for (£9,000 a year), by providing free set text books for each course they are on.
attributes.additional_details: With the decision made by the Government for tuition fees to rise further to £9,250 in the academic year of 2017, it is plausible for Parliament to enforce this.

attributes.action: Work with major chains to ban non-recyclable coffee cups ending up in landfill
attributes.background: In the UK over 2.5 billion take-away coffee cups are placed in landfill every year. The public are wrongly led to believe that these cups are actually recyclable (i.e. through environment friendly logos on the packaging). This is a major issue resulting in huge amounts of waste
attributes.additional_details:
'A conservative estimate puts the number of paper cups handed out by coffee shops in the UK at 3bn, more than 8m a day. Yet, supposedly, fewer than one in 400 is being recycled'.

I propose that the Government actively works with major coffee chains and retailers to explore the use of environmentally friendly coffee cups. As part of this, non-recyclable cups should be banned or a tax placed on them to encourage the use of 'cups for life' and bringing in a national awareness of the problem.

attributes.action: The law protecting seagulls in the UK needs to be changed or suspended.
attributes.background: In recent years, the population of seagulls has increased to the point where they are more than just a nuisance. Adults and children have been attacked as these scavengers have become the rats by the sea. Food is not safe anywhere outdoors and this is affecting local businesses and residents.
attributes.additional_details: The law needs to be changed or suspended so that people can protect themselves and their property, and the Government must also consider a humane cull of some sort.

attributes.action: Make accusing someone of been a racist without hard evidence a criminal offence.
attributes.background: In light of the recent EU referendum decision and increase in reports of hate crimes, a lot of innocent, decent and hardworking people like myself have been victims of accusations suggesting (with no proof or evidence to support their claims) that people who voted to leave the EU are somehow racist.
attributes.additional_details:
Branding someone as racist without any categorical evidence what so ever also seems to be a tactic that is becoming more of a problem in political and also everyday situations. 

Certain demographics of people are using this tactic to persecute other demographics of people in order to silence their personal views or beliefs to further their own personal or political agendas.

Been racist is a disgusting crime and been wrongly accused with no evidence can be permanently damaging to peoples lives.

attributes.action: The EU flag be flown from parliament on alternate days with the Union Flag.
attributes.background: This petition grows out of national frustration with the referendum, and at how various governments, over the decades, have failed to promote the benefits of the EU to the public at large.
attributes.additional_details:
Flags are matters of high symbolic importance. In most EU member states, the EU flag is routinely flown alongside the national flag. This practice should have been instituted in the UK long ago. 
The most prominent flagstaff in the land is that on Parliament itself. For practical reasons it may not be possible to hoist two, thus the proposal is for flying the UK and EU flags on alternate days.

attributes.action: A 5 year ban from public office for politicians who knowingly lie to the public.
attributes.background: The Brexit  debate has frustrated people on both sides. There have been many opinions put forward as facts but there have also been outright lies and some people believed them and are now annoyed. If a citizen said some of these things they would be sued but it seems OK if a politician says them.
attributes.additional_details: £350 million pounds a week will be diverted from the EU to the NHS. 75 million Turks are on their way to Britain.

attributes.action: Include Feminism as part of the primary and/or secondary school curriculum.
attributes.background: As a female sixth form student, I have come across few male peers who fully understand feminism. Many refuse to accept that gender inequality is still an issue both nationally and globally, and see feminists as man-hating groups advocating female superiority. This ignorance must be addressed.
attributes.additional_details: If people were made aware and given a full understanding of Feminism and gender inequality from a young age, they would be far more tuned in to these issues in adult life. This would be effective in helping society to become more equal and tolerant in terms of gender, which would benefit everyone, including men. The main factor inhibiting the achievement of gender equality appears to be a general ignorance of the fact that inequality exists. The way to address this ignorance is education.

attributes.action: Repeal all legislation that inhibits absolute freedom of speech.
attributes.background: If, as is the case, the British people cannot vocalise or document any or every view that we may hold, then freedom of speech no longer exists. We may not like everything that anyone says or writes but we believe it is their right to say and write what they wish.
attributes.additional_details: One such objectionable piece of legislation is Clause 127 of the  Communications Act 2003.

attributes.action: Allocate the child maintenance service with pre paid cards
attributes.background: This should be a made legal that the receiving parent receives a pre paid card that can only be spent on items for the children! Not alcohol, nights out, cigarettes ect.. I think it's time someone done something to help the paying parent for a change as they are the one out working and providing..
attributes.additional_details: I think that many paying parents would agree with what I am trying to get across.. children need the benefit of the money, not the receiving parent! A prepaid card would be best. One that can be used in certain shops for certain items. Food, soft drinks, shoes, school clothes, toys ect.. not for use for their own pleasure! Thank you

attributes.action: Give Special Constables who complete over 200 hours a year a tax incentive
attributes.background: Special Constables provide vital support to front line policing, giving up their free time, often days away from family, and even using leave from work to perform duties. Though no Special Constables do this for financial reward, all duties are performed voluntarily, often risking their own safety.
attributes.additional_details: Special Constables are expected to perform a minimum of 16 hours a month, yet most Special Constables go above and beyond, some completing upwards of 60 hours a month. One East Midlands force had Special Constables perform over 60,000 hours of duty in 2015, 59% of which were spent on frontline policing duties, responding to 999 calls and life or death situations. The rest carried out where either on local policing initiatives, community safety and training.

attributes.action: Change the dogs (fouling on land) act to include non public land
attributes.background: I live in a council property where the garden is shared. Another tennant leaves his dogs to defeacate in the garden without clearing it up. The council haven't acted in 4 months and police say can't enforce as land is not covered under the dogs (fouling on land) as its private or council property.
attributes.additional_details: I have video and photographic evidence of the fouling which has been left to rot for weeks/months where the garden is unfit for human use as confirmed by the local dog warden. The council had no housing officer covering the area so no one dealt with the complaint. Police could not act however if they could then this situation would not have got out of hand. And we wouldn't have to wait for the council.

attributes.action: Mandatory life sentence for anyone caught committing a Terror attack
attributes.background: In the light of recent terror attacks across the EU and the lenient prison sentences these individuals receive. We would like the law changed so that anyone committing or planning a terror attack, joining terror group and their accomplices receive a mandatory life sentence of no less than 25 years
attributes.additional_details: Recent terror attack in France saw a Priest beheaded by an individual recently released from Prison. He served a light sentence for trying to join an ISIS group in Syria. These people would of been safe if these individual had been jailed for life.

attributes.action: Qualify MA (LPC with Business) for Postgraduate Student Finance funding.
attributes.background: Student Finance has recently announced that from 1 August 2016 it will be possible to apply for up to £10,000 funding to pay for the course and the living expenses.  Currently this does not include the Legal Practice Course with integrated  Masters.
attributes.additional_details: Students who cannot afford to pay for the course themselves do have the opportunity to complete their Legal Practice course. If Student Finance is available for Masters, then it should also be available for the other postgraduate courses which include Masters qualification.

attributes.action: Make photo ID mandatory before being allowed to vote in Elections & Referendums
attributes.background:
Production of photo ID should be mandatory when voting in Elections and Referendums.
There have been many cases of electoral fraud through personation.
People have turned up to vote only to be turned away because someone has already voted using their name.
It's time this ceased.
attributes.additional_details:
Oldham is one of the worst places in the country for electoral fraud.
Only a few years ago, Oldham was 8th in the country for electoral fraud.
Recently, there were 4 cases of personation.
It is time that production of photo ID was made mandatory for all Elections and Referendums.
This would prevent cases of personation and go some way to creating confidence in our democratic process.
It is time that the production of photo ID was made mandatory in polling stations before anyone can vote.

attributes.action: Allow U.K. expatriates to vote in the E.U. referendum
attributes.background:
Current law prevents expatriates who have been 'ordinarily non resident' - as defined by HMRC - from voting in any U.K. election.
This inspite of the fact that a vast majority are expatriates due to employment, family or health reasons. They are also required to submit U.K. tax returns.
attributes.additional_details: Incarcerated criminals are currently denied the vote in the U.K. Are expats classed as criminals?

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for all businesses to hold a defibrillator on site.
attributes.background: Defibrillators save lives. If someone has a cardiac arrest time is everything. Having tools available to hand can give people a chance of survival.I lost my mum to cardiac arrest while she was at work & there was no difibrillator on site even though she worked in a large scale government building.
attributes.additional_details: A defibrillator is a device that gives a high energy electric shock to the heart through the chest wall to someone who is in cardiac arrest.

attributes.action: Mandatory vision and reaction check-up for all 75+ with a UK Driving license.
attributes.background: I have had personal experience of elderly drivers on wrong side of the road, being oblivious to cyclists, pulling out on roundabouts not noticing vehicles, stopping in main roads and causing serious collisions due to poor sight and reactions.
attributes.additional_details:
1 in 5 over 75 year olds in the UK are suffering with vision loss; and from research I have found there are approximately 4 Million drivers over the age of 70 on UK roads.

The current system in place allows the individual to self-assess and to alert the DVLA if they are not fit to drive. In many cases if the individual needs the car for transport they will be reluctant to inform of any changes in health, vision etc. Completing a fast assessment will eliminate any possibility of this.

attributes.action: To provide free access to swimming pools and lessons to anyone under 18 yrs old.
attributes.background: After the tragic deaths in Aug 2016 please sign my petition asking for FREE access to swimming pools & swimming lessons to anyone under the age of 18 in the UK. Around 40% of children cannot properly swim & over 400 people drown in the UK every year. There is an easy way to reduce these figures.
attributes.additional_details: I am a keen pool, sea and river swimmer who feels shocked each and every time I hear of another life lost in the beautiful waters this country has in abundance. I never again want to hear a report of someone dying trying to save another human being or rescue a pet. I strongly believe that there can only be benefits to a nationwide swimming policy that improves health and encourages the use and support of local facilities.

attributes.action: Bring the unaccompanied minors and others in the refugee camp in Calais to UK
attributes.background: To ask the Home Office to issue humanitarian visas to all those in the Calais camp (and the smaller number in Dunkerque) and arrange safe transport to Britain. As a priority, the unaccompanied minors should be brought to Britain as per the Dubs amendment.
attributes.additional_details: Two weeks ago, I went on a six day visit to the camp, having taken some aid for children and others and spent time with the people in the camp. There are businesses set up by inhabitants of the camp, some semblance of normality in an abnormal situation. There are schools, cafes and drop-in centres for the young. But the French authorities seem hell-bent on destroying such necessary amenities.  It is harassment of the most vulnerable people. Give these people the right to settle in UK.

attributes.action: Change rules for working Carers to hours worked, instead of £110 per week.
attributes.background: At the moment the rules for receiving Carer's Allowance states that you cannot earn more than £110 per week. If the government changed the rules to specify someone in receipt of CA can only work a certain number of hours instead it would be a lot more fair.
attributes.additional_details:
£110 divided by £7.20 (minimum wage) = 15 hours (approx)
£110 divided by £9.50 = 11.5 hours (approx)
Therefore someone on a lower wage is clearly disadvantaged, because they have to work longer hours to earn the weekly allowance.  This then means that the disabled person is disadvantaged by not having their carer present.

If the rules state you can work 15 hours it would be much fairer to all carers.

https://www.gov.uk/national-minimum-wage-rates
https://www.gov.uk/carers-allowance/eligibility

attributes.action: To make food banks a legal obligation for all supermarkets in the UK.
attributes.background: Food banks play a big part in helping the homeless. Fortunately, some supermarkets have food banks, however there are still many large supermarkets who don't. We want to make a change, and make it policy that all supermarkets provide food banks to give back to the community.
attributes.additional_details: It costs nothing for supermarkets to provide this service, however it will make a huge difference to those in the community who need it.

attributes.action: Exteremly poor service, revoke Govia Ltd's franchise of Great Northern Railways
attributes.background: GNR are continuously running a bad service. They have ongoing late running trains and often cancel services due to lack of staff and broken trains. They have not invested in new rolling stock and the trains are constantly dirty, seats are broken and trains break down.

attributes.action: Change all current motorcycle licensing laws.
attributes.background: The current Motorcycle licensing laws are dangerous for young riders and deter them from progressing to a higher licence. The 28MPH limit on 50cc's is extremely dangerous especially on duel carriageways. The A1 licence should be 250/300cc for motorway use, 125cc's are treacherous for motorway use.
attributes.additional_details:
Things that need to change:
1-	Remove the 28MPH limit on 50cc scooters, they are very dangerous. Most people de-restrict them anyway.
2-	Change the following classes 125cc Lerner rider; 250/300cc A1 rider; 600+cc A unrestricted rider
3-	Allow A1 upgrade system after 2 years of holding the A1 license.
4-	Change CBT to include some theory
5-	Lower the cost of tests as failing is up to £75 down the drain
6-	Make more test times available for around 5PM to 7PM Mon to fri and weekends if possible.

attributes.action: Remove Southern Railway's Franchise For Causing So Much Chaos & Disruption
attributes.background: Repeated delays and cancellations due to low staff levels has left many late and stranded. With an over complaced complaints procedure, Southern Railway customers have been left out in the cold with slim chances of any compensation.

attributes.action: Work permit for Indian restaurant skilled staff crisis
attributes.background: The Indian restaurant trade is dying due to lack of staff we need the government to help us bring skilled staff to restaurant trade to survive. Look at introducing work permits again
attributes.additional_details: Limit the amount of work permit per restaurant to limit abuse

attributes.action: EEA naturalisation and permanent residency applications .
attributes.background: Grant no changes to the application for naturalisation or permanent residency under the EEA regulations for the 5 years from the date of referendum .

attributes.action: Allow Medicinal Cannabis (Savitex) for all neurological conditions in the UK.
attributes.background: The Welsh NHS have authorised the use of Savitex medicinal cannabis for MS sufferers only in Wales to treat muscle spasticity. However, there are many people in the UK with other neurological conditions such as Cervical Myelopathy and Myelomalacia who also suffer with severe muscle spasms.
attributes.additional_details: There is no magic cure for muscle spasms. There are certain medicines such as Gabapentin, Pregabalin, Baclofen ect but many patients do not benefit from them orally. To treat severe muscle spasms, many patients are offered the insertion of a Baclofen Pump instead. A recent cost analysis by the MS Foundation has found that it is cheaper to prescribe Savitex than insert and regularly maintain a Baclofen pump. Savitex trials have proved positive in reducing muscle spasms. Please support our campaign - it is cost effective. MS sufferers are allowed the drug why can't all people suffering with neurological conditions in the UK have access to it ?

attributes.action: Seek temporary suspension of EU membership rather than irrevocably leave the EU.
attributes.background:
We, the under 50s who voted overwhelmingly to remain, demand that the future world in which we will have to live is not irrevocably dictated by the leave vote of the over 50s.
Instead, we demand temporary suspension of membership, & a further referendum once the terms of Brexit are clear.
attributes.additional_details:
It is the younger generations that will have to live with the consequences of the EU Referendum. Polls have consistently shown that the under 50s overwhelmingly support remaining in the EU. 
We demand that our future in which we and our children will grow up, train, work, and raise our families, is not permanently and irrevocably dictated by the leave vote of the over 50s against our will.

attributes.action: Control immigration to prevent overpopulation and economic depression
attributes.background: Immigration is becoming a big issue in Europe and even bigger in the UK. With current immigration levels the UK is on the path to extreme overpopulation which could mean even more strain on services such as the NHS, Housing, public transportation and almost all other public services will be affected
attributes.additional_details:
The guardian on overpopulation in Britain: http://www.theguardian.com/world/2016/feb/09/is-britain-full-home-truths-about-population-panic
Top 10 overpopulated countries (including UK(3rd party)):
http://www.newstatesman.com/blogs/the-staggers/2010/07/population-index-overpopulated
Overpopulation is clearly a highly likely event in the UK unless the government is blind to see the high population increase in the UK then they should be doing more to delay it or prevent it.

attributes.action: Ban ALL antifreeze preparations unless they contain a bitterant
attributes.background: Antifreeze products like screen wash contain Ethylene Glycol that is highly toxic and kills 1000's of pets each year.  A teaspoon is enough to kill a cat, a tablespoon a dog.  Adding a bittering agent to ALL products would take away the sweet taste and discourage animals from licking any spills.

attributes.action: Introduce regulations to govern static caravan ground rents to stop overcharging
attributes.background: The problem is that static caravan owners have very little rights and need regulations to be put in place to help protect them. A house tenant would have guidelines and a contract but static caravan owners have nothing to protect them and should have a tenancy contract for the ground they rent.
attributes.additional_details: The owners who chose to make that land into plots for static caravans should have to follow similar conditions to being a landlords as effectively thats what they are becoming.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for parents not to vaccinate a child
attributes.background:
Not vaccinating your children makes two things more likely
- Your child will get sick
- Your child will spread that illness to other unprotected children, some of whom may be too young to have received the necessary vaccination.
Therefore, not getting your child vaccinated is grossly negligent.
attributes.additional_details: Herd immunity is the primary reason for mass immunisation - in layman's terms, it means that the more people are immunised against a given disease, the less that disease will be able to spread, and more people (especially children too young to receive that specific vaccination) will be safe from it. We call on the government to criminalise non-vaccinating parents who refuse an initial order to vaccinate.

attributes.action: Scrap or Amend the TV Licence to be a subscription service and decriminalise it
attributes.background: The TV Licence is an outdated concept. We now have many choices for subscription based services such as Amazon, BT, Sky, and Virgin Media. Why must we pay money to these as well as the BBC!? The Licence is also NOT means tested. Why should someone on £30,000 a year pay the same as someone on £7000?
attributes.additional_details: 7,000 homes have blocked visits by enforcement officers by removing the 'Implied right of access' to their properties. At the very least this should be decriminalised. Many cannot afford the fee and are facing a criminal record, when previously having no record at all.

attributes.action: Host a Referendum for an English National Anthem.
attributes.background: Our proposal of a public referendum would be an effective way of allowing the people of England to choose for themselves how they wish to express their identity in our family of nations. Just as Wales are permitted with Hen Wlad Fy Nhadau, and Scotland with Flower of Scotland.
attributes.additional_details: https://web.archive.org/web/20100615152120/http://www.weareengland.org/news.asp?itemid=327&itemTitle=England+announce+victory+anthem+for+Delhi+chosen+by+the+public%21&section=115&sectionTitle=News

attributes.action: Create an Independent Body to report on the accuracy of MPs' public statements.
attributes.background: The EU referendum highlighted the damage that can be caused by false & misleading information. We the undersigned propose that an independent panel should be established to report to the public on the validity and accuracy of MPs' public comments.
attributes.additional_details: At the heart of democracy is clear information sharing & communication. MPs should therefore be held to account for the validity of information they share. We advise that the Independent Panel will assess MPs' comments upon request from the public. Each comment could be assessed as to whether it is factually correct/incorrect, verifiable/unverifiable, or misleadingly presented. There could be sanctions for repeat offenders of misleading information & an 'honesty' league table of MPs.

attributes.action: Do not invoke Article 50 of the Lisbon Treaty for five years
attributes.background: While acknowledging that Britain has voted by national referendum to leave the European Union, we the undersigned urge HM Government to withhold from invoking Article 50 of the Lisbon Treaty for a period of five years from the date of the referendum.
attributes.additional_details: This will provide the best framework for a well-managed British withdrawal from the European Union, promoting national unity, enabling fair and amicable negotiations, and preventing long term damage to the British economy.

attributes.action: Stop the resale of concert tickets at inflated prices on secondary websites.
attributes.background: Tickets sell out in record time!  then we see them for "resale" within hours on secondary ticket sale websites at ridiculously inflated prices. Reselling of football tickets is illegal under section 166 Criminal Justice and Public Order Act 1994", why can this law not apply to concert tickets?
attributes.additional_details:
The Which Reports can be found;

http://www.which.co.uk/news/2015/11/which-probes-ticket-resale-rip-off-422307/

and

http://www.which.co.uk/news/2016/05/event-tickets-still-being-sold-unlawfully-443074/
Report in Daily Telegraph relating to the recent sale of Phil Colllins Tickets at The Royal Albert Hall
http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/10/21/fan-fury-as-phil-collins-tickets-sell-out-in-15-seconds---only-t/

attributes.action: UK residents without right to vote in general elections to be income tax exempt
attributes.background: No taxation without representation. There are millions of people living, working, and paying taxes in the UK, but with no right to participate to national politics with their vote. Parliament and Government do not represent them, and should not dispose of the tax revenues raised through their work.
attributes.additional_details:
The numbers say that foreigners positively contribute to the UK revenue. The last Governments have pursued austerity policies, and have not invested this additional income to fund health, education, and housing systems. Instead, foreigners are have been blamed to put pressure on these systems.
The Government is not accountable to foreigners because they have no right to vote. This is against the spirit of John Hampden, English great patriot, who first claimed "no taxation without representation"

attributes.action: stop charging staff and service users parking at Southmead hospital in Bristol.
attributes.background: Currently cost a full time worker £300 minimum  a year for a parking permit yet there is not enough spaces. Service users are also charged for Parking.

attributes.action: Allow  my husband to live in the UK with his wife and daughter.
attributes.background: His spouse visa has been denied on the basis that 1 the financial side and 2 a place of residence upon arrival to the UK . Despite my mother writing a letter to confirm that me my husband and kids will be staying with her until we found a place of our own.
attributes.additional_details: we clearly mentioned in our appeal that life in the US wasn't good and I wanted to come home to the UK to be with my family and our daughter can grow up with her cousins something we don't have in the US.we arrived in the UK to spend time with the family our daughter goes to stay n play which she loves and is able to go to nursery for 15 hrs a week she's settled down perfectly my wife is staying in the UK to settle down get a house  our daughter and son can be with the family They are thriving.

attributes.action: Tax breaks for Arts subject tuition, for school age children.
attributes.background: Arts education for young people continues to be subject to yearly cuts. Arts tuition outside of school education is costly, but now necessary to provide sufficient learning opportunities for talented children. This is inaccessible to many families. Help end the elitism and value the arts.
attributes.additional_details:
UK government prioritises "core" subjects (Maths, English, Sciences, Language, History Geography) by way of the EBacc performance measure: http://bit.ly/1QiubcJ  Whereas these subjects should be valued, it's at the expense of arts subjects. 

What is being asked here is a small contribution to arts education, that would actually help boost the economy at the same time. The Warwick Commission estimates the arts sector represents 5% of the British economy valued at £76.9bn: http://bit.ly/1EJWbkV

attributes.action: Dads given 10 weeks parental leave with pay for more time with their new born
attributes.background: I believe dads should be around more with there new born child, some fathers work late nights and end up having to only see the new born child while they are sleeping. 2 weeks isn't anywhere near acceptable amount of time, also having dad home longer it will be great help for the mother and bonding.
